comment: He is kind of intimidating during lecture. However, if you know your stuff and actually try, he will love you. Homework is harder than quizzes and tests, but that's actually a blessing! He is very helpful and supportive when you're 1 on 1 with him. Know he's very sarcastic!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Hilarious--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Bruce is a very rude and condescending professor. If you email him, he will respond in a somewhat threatening way. He treats everything you say as if it were blatantly obvious. If you care about your GPA and personal sanity, avoid him.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Do the study guides and you'll do fine on the tests I promise. He's a tough teacher but a good one. ASK QUESTIONS. He will work out entire problems for you but you gotta ask! Only thing to worry about is those pop quizzes!! So make sure you stay on top of it!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Calculus 2 is a very hard class that covers complex topics. Mr. Thomas helps explain these complex topics in an easy to understand form. He really wants you to learn the material. He wants you to participate during lectures, complete the homework, and study for tests. He makes you work hard for your grade, but all of your hard work will pay off.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Hilarious

comment: When I got my test back he said that i was "pathetic".

This class is probably the hardest math class I have ever taken. I have gotten A's in every math until now. He likes to "teach" by going over the textbook ver very briefly without actually working out how to do the problems. He will only work a full problem when asked. You have to learn everything yourself and even then its hard. Pop quizzes too.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Very difficult course but if you are struggling he is very helpful and a great 1 on 1 teacher during his office hours. Make sure to do the extra credit in the beginning of the course, you'll need it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Thomas was incredible! He really is a great instructor for Cal 2. He not only explains things well but he is also hilarious. He gives lots of extra credit, and his test reviews are fantastic. Missing a lecture is really not smart for two reasons: you don't learn the subject and you could either miss a quiz or an extra credit opportunity
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Tough class, Calc 2 throws a lot of topics at you that you not only have to understand but apply. He is a great teacher and explains well, homework is generous and offers many opportunities for extra credit. His grading is generous, (usually 1-2 points off for dropped constants and the such). Practice tests are similar to the tests.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Beware of pop quizzes--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Nice guy, but one of the worst math teachers I've had. Made calc2 a lot harder than it needs to be. Be ready to read each chapter on your own to teach yourself the material because class alone won't help much. Study guides are somewhat like the tests, so that's good. He also throws in some pop quizzes here and there. Would never take him again tbh
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Be sure to do his extra credit, it counts for a lot. Most quizzes are unannounced, so be sure to show up. He gives lots of partial credit on tests. He drops the lowest test grade out of 4. He drops the two lowest quizzes out of 8. There is Webassign, but it is very easy and you get bonus points on it if you do it early.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I took him about a year ago. He was a fair teacher. I taught myself most of the material from Youtube and did fine. Tests are doable (no multiple choice all written) and he is a lenient grader. He likes giving pop quizzes and there is a fair amount of homework (online on WebAssign).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Most of the comments are useless. He does teach out of the book and could use a better variety of examples, also he does go off on the occasional tangent (but with reason), however, that's where the negatives end. Calc2 will never be easier than this. He isn't a tough grader and the practice tests are pure gold. Would tell a friend to take!
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I don't like how he teaches straight from the book, it makes his lecture incredibly boring. Luckily he offers tons of extra credit and he gives study guides that are very similar to the test. He's not horrible, but I've had better.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class is an easy A if you stay on top of the HW and are an active participant. He really rewards the actively participating students with incentives like, extra points for homework completed 2 days before the test and extra credit quizzes taken in class. He also explains the material fairly well and is extremely helpful one to one.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: skims thru book in class and goes off on tangents so easy to zone out during lectures, moderate amnt of hw that helps with the tests, doesnt go over examples that will be on the test, does go over hw in class, will answer questions, study guides are general and dont help, i got a high grade only b/c i took calc in high school, quizzes
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: He's a great teacher if you have a basic understanding of Calculus. He's intelligent and holds his students to a high standard but in return you hold yourself higher. He might give a bit of work but in order to understand the class it's necessary. I would encourage you taking his class if you're trying to get something out of the class.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof Thomas was accessible outside of class and willing to help. But if you have trouble learning math from a book then he is not for you. His teaching style isn't for everyone. No notes, the book is everything.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Stay on top of the material from Day 1; if you pay attention & put in the work do the WebAssign homework (ahead of time for extra credit), study from the study guides (which is basically the tests with different numbers), & listen/participate in class then it's an easy A. Don't get complacent. If you write the notes you don't need the book. Take.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Not a hard class at all if you put in the work.  He explains everything very clearly.  Has study guides before the tests that basically mirror the tests themselves.  The material is presented in an easy to understand way.  He can be boring at times, but put in the work and you'll get an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This guy has got me conflicted. He can be a jerk at times when a student asks a question, yet is so polite if you ask him during office hours. Some things to note:  -7 quizzes but he'll drop the lowest 2 -4 tests but he'll drop the lowest -Lots of extra credit -25 homework assignments An "A" is achievable as long as you work for it
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Turn the other way. Professor Thomas is a horrible teacher! He is rude, non-helpful, and does not explain things well. I have always been an A+ student in Math, and I am failing his class. I learned more from the homework than in his class. His "Study Guides" are just pages from the book to read and are nothing like the test. Take ANYBODY but him!
He was a great professor if you are a hard core math student. On some subjects he does not explain them very well. He is approachable, but you have to go up and ask questions.

Great teacher. He will help you if you need help but you have to ask. He is not a teacher for young immature students. Just do your work and make sure that you understand. He is very sarcastic but he is approachable.

This guy is great for someone who is not 18 fresh out of high school.  He likes teaching older students, but grades everyone the same.  He is available during office hours, so make sure you see him about questions.  DO THE HOMEWORK, GO TO EVERY CLASS, AND DO ALL THE EXTRA CREDIT!!!!  It got me a B, oh yeah you don't need the book, just the E-book

If you just need someone to tell you what the material is for you to get it, take Mr. Thomas.  But if math isn't your thing, I don't think he's the best choice.  In many lectures we only got through 3 or 4 problems.  He confuses himself sometimes.  He's not the best explainer.  All quizzes are unannounced.  He does grade nicely though.

His lectures get confusing because he leaves some steps out when working out a problem which confuses and loses a lot of students. He's pretty rude towards students sometimes but can be funny too. Sometimes, the students have to correct him and he doesn't give clear explanations about solutions. If there are other math teachers take them instead.

I'll say Prof. Thomas was a good teacher since  it seemed like some people got it. However many didn't at the same time. His teaching didn't work for me. If you're already good at math you can try it. If not try to find another Prof. HW can be long but its unlimited tries. Gives quizzes. Tests are pretty tough unless you have A LOT of time to study

One of the teachers that force students to buy a specific textbook and do homework. Tests are tough, even though he pretends to give extra credit. Gives extra credit for full attendance. Would not take him again if there were any other options

It can be better in many ways but overall it was not the worst experience I had. He lacks the respect for his students and usually a couple minutes late but the class was a nice experience all things considered. Pretty average...

Your grade is made up your tests, final, and MyMathLab homework. Don't buy the book, it's on MyMathLab. Your final also replaces your lowest test, which you will be thankful for. He teaches straight from the book. I find him rude and when you ask a question he makes you feel like you're dumb. Tests are part multiple choice. Difficult.

I liked this class. The study guides are exactly like the tests just different numbers. I made a D on the second test due to running out of time but he gives extra credit for perfect attendance and I still ended up with an A in the class. He will poke fun at you for asking questions but will answer them.
The study guides are exactly like the tests!

Honestly, Professor Thomas is a good professor. I don't understand all the bad reviews he's gotten. The study guides are almost identical to the tests, and he even provides an annotated stepbystep study guide. He rants on sometimes, makes a few mistakes, and is sarcastic,but is DEFINITELY a good math teacher to take if you need to get an easy A.

He is hard! If you havent taken EVERY possible class before his, I wouldnt suggest it to anybody. He drops your 2 lowest quiz grades, but with the level of difficulty, it doesnt do much to help. Im pretty good at math, but he moves WAY too quickly and doesnt spend much time on anything. He is REALLY old, so I assume thats where the problem starts.

This has to be the most arrogant  and unhelpful teacher i have ever had. When i tried asking him for help he spoke to me like i was dumb and told me i should no this all already. in other words, he was no help. Take another teacher

He's a good teacher but I found him to be actually very rude at times. He started out nice at the beginning of the semester but he really made me mad a few times with the way he talked to me which confused me because I was a quiet, hardworking student, so just be prepared to deal with that. He tends to call people out for no reason.

Mr. Thomas is the best! Had him for Calculus I. Due to the fact that he's a bit older, he could, at times, be a bit monotone. However, I learned a lot, he was funny, and, overall, really made the class enjoyable and worth attending. If you pay attention and do your homework, you will do just fine in his class.
The class is easy as long as you do the homework and study guides. He's really willing to help as well.

His class is really boring. If you do the homework  on my math lab and know how to do the problems then you'll be fine. He makes the exams just like the study guides. He only uses the book online and presents problems from it to the class.

Really good teacher! I recommend taking his class. The Calculus doesn't magically jump into your head. You have to put time into learning the material (homework) outside of class, and then when you come into class he will go over as many questions as you need. The practice tests are very helpful. He genuinely wants his students to succeed.

Currently taking Calculus with Thomas. He is extremely helpful- at the beginning of every class he asks if anyone has questions about homework- he will literally show you every step of the problem. Practice tests are literally the tests with different numbers in the problem. If you come to class, you can do well. If you don't, it's your own fault.

It is my displeasure to go to his class in the morning. He talks about stuff that's so off topic it's crazy and boring. You have to teach yourself the material and students correct him often. Attendance isn't mandatory, but there's a quiz every other day. Boring, but easy to cram for test. He's monotone. Take another math modeling professor.

I'm curious if we are confused about professors. He is NONE of the amazing things being said. I studied for five days for the test, got a 100 on all homework, and memorized the study guide which on here is said to be identical to the test and I got a 46 on the test. He doesn't show how to do work he doesn't give notes. He just lectures how to do the work. His voice is the most annoying thing ever. Unless you have a god given talent for calculus DO NOTTTTT TAKE HIM!!!!!

I'm sitting in his class right now and I'm about to kill myself. He doesn't give you notes to copy on the board. He just TELLS you what to do. His voice is making me want to die. He is arrogant and annoying. Thank god for mathlab. I'm just going to have to teach myself calculus.

HORRIBLE! unless you are good at math an can teach your self do not take him. I did very well in highschool math but barley pulled through with his class, if it was not for the math lab I would not have passed

Take him. He is a very good teacher. If you apply yourself you will make an A, (this is college after all). Homework is on MyMathLab, so that's a guaranteed A (you have unlimited tries). The study guides are identical to the test and he gives you the answers to the study guides. He is pretty funny as well. I hate math and got a 97.

Advice... do not waste your money. He does not "teach" the first half of the semester (he assumes you know the material) and snaps at students who ask logical questions. Worst KSU teacher experience ever!  He should not be teaching this class because it is "beneath" him.  If you want to learn Modeling go with Koppelman or Davis.

Professor Thomas was an uninteresting, and often dull professor. When he went over the material, he relied more on the tutors at the math lab than trusting his own ability to teach the subject. His tests were exremely difficult and never curved any of his tests. I had a "C" in the class and he gave me a "D" at the end, even though I worked diligent

Mr.Thomas is actually a GREAT professor. He comes across as quirky and somewhat rude in the beginning, but if you just put the effort into his class he will become more respectful and actually funny. Overall his class was pretty easy, I absolutely hate math and walked away from the class with a 98 average.

He is a good teacher, with a refreshing sense of humor. Im glad I had him for math and would recommend him. Do the homework, show up for the quizzes, and you should be okay. You have to buy the book, homework is online.

Professor Thomas rocks!  If you make less than a B in his class, you must either not pay attention or attend class or be just plain dumb.  He explains everything clearly and really cares about his students.  I also found his humor funny too.  I HIGHLY recommend taking him for MATH 1106

Horrible teacher. I tried to ask him a question about the homework and he accused me of not showing up for class even though I sit in front of him everyday!He refuses to curve the test even though a majority of the class failed! In my opinion he's way to arrogant to be teaching.
Professor Thomas was the best teacher I have ever had. He really cares about his students and wants every one to get an A.

This class was a lot of work but it was worth it. I failed the first test(48/100) so I worked hard i.e. memorized his practice tests and did the Mathxl. I never bought the textbook. I ended up with a B from a F at the beginning of the semester!

AMAZING! Really cares about his students. He does come across a little like he is talking down to them. Don't buy the book, I never cracked it. Test are almost identical to the practice test some of it is identical. I got a high B without trying. Homework...just do it, it really doesn't help you learn. MEMORIZE the practice tests!!! Great class!!!
Horrible teacher! doesn't explain material well, and speaks to everyone like they are 5. If you like teaching yourself, then take his class. Takes off tons of points on tests for random things.

Professor Thomas is excellent. He is REALLY good at explaining Calc! Attendance not mandatory, but you don't to miss his lectures because he REALLY does know how to make it make sense! I got an A. DO MATHZONE HW. Talks to u like you're 5 if the class slacks off, but don't take it personally if YOU do YOUR homework. Thomas rocks. I recommend him:)

Attendance is not mandatory but if you miss classes you miss a bunch of information.  He gives you the practices test which are practically 80% the same as the test, he gives opportunity for bonus points after the second test, he is concerned about your grade and cracks jokes from time to time.  Do not skip out on MZone HW!

Run for your life! Worst math teacher ever. Does nothing but talk down to the students. Gives you a practice test, but the actual test is way harder. Assigns tons and tons of homework. All three of his classes flunk the first two tests. If you want to learn math on your own take this guy.
Professor Thomas was great. He explains things well in class and gives sample tests before each exam. Exams are very similar to sample tests.
I attempted Calc 2 other times and dropped it at KSU. Mr Thomas is much better than some of the other math professors there.

WOW... All the people below me that rated this man as a good professor are very mistaken. Do not get me wrong his class is not hard (If you are VERY strong in math) but he so incredibily unclear when explaining things. TERRIBLE PROFESSOR!! & if I hear him call a set of equation "these guys" one more time I will DIE!
This professor is very pompous in my opinion. He gives an evaluation of his students prior to ever seeing their work. He was not very helpful and very demeaning.

Prof Thomas was always available if you needed help.  He gave good examples and went over homework assigned thru MYMATHLAB in class.  This helped with completing homework.  Come to class w/?'s so you can get the most out of his teachings.  He gives practices test which are VERY SIMILIAR to the actual.  I got a 95%!!  Yahoo!!

great teacher.  if you suck at math, take him!!! gives practice tests that the actual tests come straight from. just make sure you go to class so that you can do mymathlab. mymathlab was the only reason i got a B, i didn't do it.
Hardest part is my math lab.  Be able to do all the problems (or opportunites as he calls them) on the reviews and making below an A on the test will be mathmaticly impossible.
Excellent teacher!!!! If you're not that great in math, he is definitely the teacher to take....he will make sure you understand it.
Great professor!! He makes things very clear. Tests are not hard because he always gives practice tests before the actual test. Question on tests are based on practice tests. I'm getting an A :)
Great teacher and great person. He really wants his students to do good. If you have trouble with math take him.

If you fear math and do not think you will do well take Mr. Thomas.  He is a wonderful instructor and cares if you learn the material.  You must to the work but it is worth it.  I took another professor and failed; Mr. Thomas helped me turn that around.
Showed a geniune concern for every student doing well in his class.
He is very good at teaching - that's why I took him twice. I wouln't advise talking to him if you can avoid it. He's not a very nice person and can't resist making snide remarks.

Class is very interesting, and he makes sure it is. He posts practices test before the test and they are the same, only different numbers, but be sure and do the homework cause he quizzes you on it. But go and meet with him outside of class and you will do fine.

Makes Calculus much easier to understand.  Explains things thouroughly and clearly, and if you are willing to put in the effort he's willing to help you out.  Gives 10 random quizzes based on homework, and practice tests that are almost the real thing.  Show up, pay attention and it's an easy A.
good teacher, willing to break problems down so that eveyone will understand.  but have to go to class b/c he gives homework quizes.
His review sheets are a near-perfect road map to the tests. Quizzes function as homework check. Does a good job of explaining tricky concepts and isn't married to doing everything the textbook's way.

He teaches every step VERY clearly.  He also will answer all questions and is willing to help anyone who needs it.  He is enthusiastic but has random mood swings.  There are 3 tests plus a final, and a group project.  There are group activities and homework during class throughout the semester.
i got an A! very easy to understand, just do your homework.
Amazing teacher! He puts everything in to terms that you can understand, and can always relate it to real life. He gives alot of take home quizzes that are based on optional homework. Easy A!

You must spend 3 hrs per week studying the material, but he is very patient with students who put in the effort.  He explains concepts slowly and clearly, but he has to move forward with material.  Revew sheet is basically same as the exam.  Great teacher
